DataElement.preferredName: Cardiac Condition NYHA Congestive Heart Failure Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no/not applicable indicator that describes if patient has Class II-IV New York Heart Association (NYHA) congestive heart failure.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Having to do with the heart._A state of being, such as a state of health._Failure of the heart to pump a sufficient amount of blood to meet the needs of the body tissues, resulting in tissue congestion and edema. Signs and symptoms include shortness of breath, pitting edema, enlarged tender liver, engorged neck veins, and pulmonary rales.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Having to do with the heart.:A state of being, such as a state of health.

Concepts.definition: Having to do with the heart.
A state of being, such as a state of health.

Property.preferredDefinition: A complication of HEART DISEASES. Defective cardiac filling and/or impaired contraction and emptying, resulting in the heart's inability to pump a sufficient amount of blood to meet the needs of the body tissues or to be able to do so only with an elevated filling pressure. (from Braunwald, Heart Disease, 5th ed)

Concepts.definition: Failure of the heart to pump a sufficient amount of blood to meet the needs of the body tissues, resulting in tissue congestion and edema. Signs and symptoms include shortness of breath, pitting edema, enlarged tender liver, engorged neck veins, and pulmonary rales.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 6/24/14 created for Theradex eligibility CRF. jc

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have history or evidence of current Class II, III, or IV heart failure as defined by the New York Heart Association (NYHA) functional classification system?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Class II-IV New York Heart As
ReferenceDocuments.description: Class II-IV New York Heart Association (NYHA) congestive heart failure.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history or evidence of current greater than or equal to Class II congestive heart failure as defined by the New York Heart Association (NYHA) functional classification system?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have congestive heart failure (CHF): New York Heart Association (NYHA) Class III (moderate) or Class IV (severe) at the time of screening?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have NYHA classification III or IV?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have heart failure NYHA Class II or above (for the NYHA Classification)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have significant cardiac disease (e.g. NYHA class III-IV congestive heart failure, unstable angina, recent myocardial infarction within the last 6 months, etc.)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has congestive heart failure New York Heart Association (NYHA) class 3 or 4, or a history of congestive heart failure NYHA class 3 or 4 in the past, or history of anthracycline or anthracenedione (mitoxantrone) treatment, does a screening echocardiogram or multi-gated acquisition scan performed within 3 months of the screening visit results in a left ventricular ejection fraction that is greater than or equal to 45%?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: If a patient has known history or current symptoms of cardiac disease or history of treatment with cardiotoxic agents; has a clinical risk assessment of cardiac function using the New York Heart Association Functional Classification been performed?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have congestive heart failure NYHA classification III or IV?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have congestive heart failure greater than New York Heart Association (NYHA) class 2?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 11
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have New York Heart Association class III or IV heart disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 12
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have any of the following cardiac diseases currently or within the last 6 months (by New York Heart Association (NYHA) greater than or equal to Class 2 where applicable): unstable angina pectoris; congestive heart failure or known reduced LVEF less than 55%; acute myocardial infarction; conduction abnormality not controlled with pacemaker or medication e.g. complete left bundle branch block, third degree heart block, or significant ventricular or supraventricular arrhythmias?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 13
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have any of the following cardiac diseases currently or within the last 6 months (by New York Heart Association (NYHA) greater than or equal to Class 2 where applicable): unstable angina pectoris; congestive heart failure or known reduced LVEF less than 55%; acute myocardial infarction; conduction abnormality not controlled with pacemaker or medication e.g. complete left bundle branch block, third degree heart block, or significant ventricular or supraventricular arrhythmias?  Patients with chronic rate-controlled atrial fibrillation in the absence of other cardiac abnormalities are eligible.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 14
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have history or evidence of current greater than or equal to Class II congestive heart failure as defined by New York Heart Association (NYHA)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 16
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has a known history or current symptoms of cardiac disease, or history of treatment with cardiotoxic agents, has a clinical risk assessment of cardiac function performed using the New York Heart Association Functional Classification, with a result of class 2B or better?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 17
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a medical history of myocardial infarction within 6 months before enrollment, symptomatic congestive heart failure (CHF) (New York Heart Association Class II to IV), or with troponin levels consistent with myocardial infarction (as defined according to the assay manufacturer) 28 days prior to enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 15
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have any of the following cardiac diseases currently or within the last 6 months: unstable angina pectoris, acute myocardial infarction, congestive heart failure greater than or equal to class 2 (as defined by New York Heart Association (NYHA), conduction abnormality not controlled with pacemaker or medication, or significant ventricular or supraventricular arrhythmias (patients with chronic rate-controlled atrial fibrillation in the absence of other cardiac abnormalities are eligible)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 18
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have uncontrolled congestive heart failure (New York Heart Association, NYHA class III, IV)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 19
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a medical history of myocardial infarction within 6 months before enrollment, symptomatic congestive heart failure (CHF) (New York Heart Association Class IIb to IV), or with troponin levels consistent with myocardial infarction (as defined according to the assay manufacturer) 28 days prior to enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 20
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have any of the following cardiac criteria:  corrected QT interval calculated by the Fredericia formula (QTcF) greater than 450msec by electrocardiogram (ECG); Concomitant use of any agent known to cause QTc prolongation; Clinically significant conduction abnormalities or arrhythmias; presence of a cardiac pacemaker or defibrillator with a paced ventricular rhythm limiting ECG analysis; History or evidence of current greater than or equal to Class II congestive heart failure as defined by New York Heart Association (NYHA); History of acute coronary syndromes (including unstable angina and myocardial infarction), coronary angioplasty, or stenting within the past 6 months; History of stent placement requiring ongoing antithrombotic therapy (e.g. clopidogrel, parasugrel); Clinically significant cardiomegaly, ventricular hypertrophy, or cardiomyopathy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 21
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had an any of the following within 6 months before starting treatment:  stroke, myocardial infarction, severe/unstable angina pectoris, coronary/peripheral artery bypass graft; congestive heart failure New York Heart Association (NYHA) Class III or IV?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 22
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have class III or IV heart failure as defined by the NYHA functional classification system?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 23
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has a known history or current symptoms of cardiac disease, or history of treatment with cardiotoxic agents, has a clinical risk assessment of cardiac function performed using the New York Heart Association Functional Classification, with a result of class II or better?

DataElement.changeDescription: 6/24/14 created for Theradex eligibility CRF. jc
